property.name: userLevelDocumentation
property.configure:
This actor reads input tokens and writes them, one line at a time, to a specified file. The format it uses is that generated by the toString() method of the token, which for most tokens is an expression that can be read back in using ExpressionReader. String tokens, for example, include the enclosing quotation marks in the output. If you do not want the enclosing quotation marks, use LineWriter.

The file is specified by the fileName attribute using any form acceptable to FileParameter.

If the append attribute has value true, then the file will be appended to. If it has value false, then if the file exists, the user will be queried for permission to overwrite, and if granted, the file will be overwritten.

If the confirmOverwrite parameter has value false, then this actor will overwrite the specified file if it exists without asking. If true (the default), then if the file exists, then this actor will ask for confirmation before overwriting.

property.name: port:input
property.configure: The input port, which is a multiport.

property.name: port:fileName
property.configure: The file name to which to write. This is a string with any form accepted by FilePortParameter. The default value is "System.out".

property.name: prop:append
property.configure: If true, then append to the specified file. If false (the default), then overwrite any preexisting file after asking the user for permission.

property.name: prop:alwaysFlush
property.configure: If true, flush output after each line is written. If false (the default), the output may not be written until the stream is closed during wrapup().

property.name: prop:endOfLineCharacter
property.configure: End of line character to use. This is a string that defaults to null, which results in the current platform's standard end-of-line character being used. If an empty string is specified, then no end of line character is used after each output written to the file.

property.name: prop:confirmOverwrite
property.configure: If false, then overwrite the specified file if it exists without asking. If true (the default), then if the file exists, ask for confirmation before overwriting.

property.name: prop:fileName
property.configure: The file name to which to write. This is a string with any form accepted by FilePortParameter. The default value is "System.out".
